description: Adds or removes a user from a MySQL database.
author: Mark Theunissen
notes: Requires the MySQLdb Python package on the remote host. For Ubuntu, this is as easy as apt-get install python-mysqldb.

Both C(login_password) and C(login_username) are required when you are passing credentials. If none are present, the module will attempt to read the credentials from C(~/.my.cnf), and finally fall back to using the MySQL default login of 'root' with no password.

examples.description: Create database user with name 'bob' and password '12345' with all database privileges
Ensure no user named 'sally' exists, also passing in the auth credentials.

short_description: Adds or removes a user from a MySQL database.

description: name of the user (role) to add or remove
